snippet: A panel of federal judges directed free Internet radio services like Pandora to pay 17 cents per 100 plays, less than the 25 cents record companies had sought.
abstract: Panel of federal judges increases royalty that free Internet radio services like Pandora will pay record companies for next five years; decision means that Pandora will pay millions of dollars more in royalties.
lead_paragraph: A panel of federal judges directed free Internet radio services like Pandora to pay 17 cents per 100 plays, less than the 25 cents record companies had sought.

headline.main: Streaming Royalties Rise, but Not as High as Music Industry Wanted
headline.print_headline: Judges Set Streaming Royalties Higher, but Not as High as Music Industry Wanted
